sen.j: 臨済宗（臨濟宗、りんざいしゅう）は、中国禅五家七宗（ごけしちしゅう）（臨済、潙仰宗、曹洞宗、雲門宗、法眼宗）のひとつで、唐の臨済義玄（？-867年）を宗祖とする。
sen.e: The Rinzai Sect is one of the Chinese 5 Houses/7Sects of Zen (Rinzai, Igyou, Soto, Unmon, Hogan) and Gigen RINZAI (? - 867) of Tang was its founder.
The Rinzai Sect is one of the Chinese five Houses/seven Sects of Zen (Rinzai, Igyou, Soto, Unmon, Hogan) and Gigen RINZAI (? - 867) of Tang was its founder.
Rinzai Zen Buddhism is one of the Chinese five Houses/seven Schools of Zen (Rinzai, Igyou, Soto, Unmon, Hogan) and Gigen RINZAI (? - 867) of Tang was its founder.

sen.j: 彼は『喝の臨済』『臨済将軍』の異名で知られ、豪放な家風を特徴として中国禅興隆の頂点を極めた。
sen.e: He was known as "Singing RINZAI" and "General RINZAI", and rose to the top of Chinese Zen with his distinctive, earnest style.
He was known as "Singing RINZAI" and "General RINZAI", and rose to the top of Chinese Zen with his distinctive, earnest style.
He was known as "RINZAI of Katu (meaning to help wake up the sleeping mind) " and "General RINZAI", and rose to the top of Chinese Zen with his distinctive style.
sen.cmt: ”喝の臨済”を"Singing RINZAI"と訳すのは違う気がするので、あえて日本語の喝を使い、その意味を補足。「a means」を「meaning」に、「earnest」を削除しました（再チェック）。

sen.j: 公案に参究することにより見性しようとする看話禅（かんなぜん）で、ただ座禅する曹洞宗の黙照禅とはこの点が異なる。
sen.e: With its Zen Talks that try to awaken self awareness through study of Koan, it differs from the Silent Zen of the Soto sect, which just does meditation.
With its Zen Talks that try to awaken self awareness through study of Koan, it differs from the Silent Zen of the Soto sect, which just does meditation.
With its Zen Talks that try to awaken self awareness through study of Koan, it differs from the Silent Zen of the Soto sect, which just does meditation.

sen.j: 中国における臨済宗
sen.e: Rinzai in China
Rinzai Sect in China
Rinzai School in China

sen.j: 臨済宗は、その名の通り、会昌の廃仏後、唐末の宗祖臨済義玄に始まる。
sen.e: As the name implies, Rinzai started with its founder Gigen RINZAI at the end of the Tang dynasty, after the death of Kaishou.
As the name implies, Rinzai Sect started with its founder Gigen RINZAI at the end of the Tang dynasty, after the death of Kaishou.
As the name implies, Rinzai School started with its founder Gigen RINZAI at the end of the Tang dynasty, after the anti-Buddhist movement at the Kaishou era.
sen.cmt: 会昌は人名ではなく年号 廃仏→ the anti-Buddhist movement

sen.j: 臨済は黄檗希運の弟子であり、河北省の地を拠点とし、新興の藩鎮勢力であった成徳府藩鎮の王常侍を支持基盤として宗勢を伸張したが、唐末五代の混乱した時期には、河北は5王朝を中心に混乱した地域であったため、宗勢が振るわなくなる。
sen.e: RINZAI was the disciple of Kiun OBAKU; the sect grew as a religious movement centered in the province of Hebei, with the support of Changji WANG of the Hanchin government, but in the confusion that arose around the end of the Tang dynasty, Hebei was at the center of the tumultuous 5 dynasties and it became difficult to sustain a religious movement.

RINZAI was the disciple of Kiun OBAKU; the sect grew as a religious movement centered in the province of Hebei, with the support of Changji WANG of the Hanchin government, but in the confusion that arose around the end of the Tang dynasty, Hebei was at the center of the tumultuous five dynasties and it became difficult to sustain a religious movement.

RINZAI was the disciple of Kiun OBAKU; the school grew as a religious movement centered in the province of Hebei, with the support of Changshi WANG of the Hanchin government, but in the confusion that arose around the end of the Tang dynasty, Hebei was at the center of the tumultuous five dynasties and it became difficult to sustain a religious movement.
sen.cmt: 王常侍→Changshi WANG （再チェック）

sen.j: この時期の中心人物は、風穴延昭である。
sen.e: The central actor around that time was Nobuaki FUUKETSU.
The central figure around that time was Ensho FUUKETSU.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。｢風穴延昭」は中国の人なので、延昭の表記はエンショウではないか。裏づけはとれていない。
sen.e: The central figure around that time was Enshou FUKETSU.

sen.j: 臨済宗が再び活気に満ち溢れるようになるのは、北宋代であり、石霜楚円の門下より、ともに江西省を出自とする、黄龍慧南と楊岐方会という、臨済宗の主流となる2派（黄龍派・楊岐派）を生む傑僧が出て、中国全土を席巻することとなった。
sen.e: It was in the Northern Song dynasty that Rinzai became vibrant again, below the gates of Sekiso Soen, along with Kainan KORYU and Houe YOUGI who came from Jiangxi province and created the two main branches of Rinzai (Koryu and Yogi), and swept across all of China.

It was in the Northern Song dynasty that Rinzai Sect became vibrant again, below the gates of Sekiso SOEN, along with Kainan KORYU and Houe YOUGI who came from Jiangxi province and created the two main branches of Rinzai (Koryu and Yougi), and swept across all of China.
sen.cmt: 苗字の表記修正、表記の統一
sen.e: It was in the Northern Song dynasty that Rinzai School became vibrant again, below the gates of Sekiso SOEN, along with Enan OURYU and Houe YOUGI who came from Jiangxi province and created the two main sectes of Rinzai (Ouryu and Yougi), and swept across all of China.

sen.j: 南宋代になると、楊岐派に属する圜悟克勤の弟子の大慧宗杲が、浙江省を拠点として大慧派を形成し、臨済宗の中の主流派となった。
sen.e: When it came to the Southern Song dynasty, Sougou DAIKAN, a disciple of Kokugon ENGO who was part of the Yogi branch, started the Daikan branch in Zhejiang province, which became a major branch withing Rinzai.

When it came to the Southern Song dynasty, Sougou DAIKAN, a disciple of Kokugon ENGO who belonged to the Yougi branch, started the Daikan branch in Zhejiang province, which became a major branch in the Rinzai Sect.
sen.cmt: 表記の統一、自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: When it came to the Southern Song dynasty, Soukou DAIE, a disciple of Kokugon ENGO who belonged to the Yougi sect, started the Daikan sect in Zhejiang province, which became a major sect in the Rinzai School.

sen.j: 日本における臨済宗
sen.e: Rinzai in Japan
Rinzai Sect in Japan
Rinzai School in Japan

sen.j: 宗門では、ゴータマ・シッダッタの教え（悟り）を直接に受け継いだ十大弟子（迦葉）から28代目のボーディダルマ（菩提達磨）を得てインドから中国に伝えられた、ということになっている。
sen.e: According to doctrine, it was brought over to China from India by Bodhidharma, the 28th successor of the 10 disciples who directly received the teaching (enlightenment) of Siddhartha Gautama.
According to doctrine, it was brought over to China from India by Bodhidharma, the 28th successor of the 10 disciples who directly received the teaching (enlightenment) of Siddhartha Gautama.

According to doctrine, it was brought over to China from India by Bodhidharma, the 28th successor of the 10 disciples (called Kasho) who directly received the teaching (enlightenment) of Siddhartha Gautama.
sen.cmt: 迦葉→Kashoが抜けているので補足。

sen.j: その後、禅宗の最高峰を極めた臨済宗は、南宋時代の中国に渡り学んだ栄西らによって、鎌倉時代に日本に伝えられている。
sen.e: Later the Rinzai sect, which achieved the pinnacle of Zen teaching, was brought to Japan in the Kamakura period by Eisai, who crossed over to China in the Southern Song period to study.
Later the Rinzai sect, which achieved the pinnacle of Zen teaching, was brought to Japan in the Kamakura period by Eisai, who went to China to study in the Southern Song period.
Later the Rinzai school, which achieved the pinnacle of Zen teaching, was brought to Japan in the Kamakura period by Eisai, who went to China to study in the Southern Song period.

sen.j: 日本の臨済宗は、日本の禅の宗派のひとつである。
sen.e: Japan's Rinzai sect is one of Japan's Zen sects.
Japan's Rinzai Sect is one of Zen sects.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。表記の統一。
sen.e: Japan's Rinzai is one of Zen schools in Japan.

sen.j: 師から弟子への悟りの伝達（法嗣、はっす）を重んじる。
sen.e: It emphasizes the transmission of enlightenment from teacher to disciple.
It emphasizes the transmission of enlightenment from teacher to disciple.
It emphasizes the transmission of enlightenment from teacher to disciple. (Hassu is the disciple who inherited the teaching of the master.)
sen.cmt: 法嗣 (Hassu)が抜けているので補足。

sen.j: 釈迦を本師釈迦如来大和尚と、ボーディダルマを初祖菩提達磨大師、臨済を宗祖臨済大師と呼ぶ。
sen.e: It calls Sakyamuni the Original Teacher Venerable Sakyamuni Buddha, Bodhidharma the First Ancestor and Great Teacher Bodhidharma, and RINZAI Founder and Great Teacher Rinzai.
It calls Sakyamuni the Original Teacher Venerable Sakyamuni Buddha, Bodhidharma the First Ancestor and Great Teacher Bodhidharma, and RINZAI Founder and Great Teacher Rinzai.
It calls Sakyamuni the Original Teacher Venerable Sakyamuni Buddha, Bodhidharma the First Ancestor and Great Teacher Bodhidharma, and RINZAI the Founder and Great Teacher Rinzai.

sen.j: 同じ禅宗の曹洞宗が地方豪族や一般民衆に広まったのに対し、臨済宗は時の武家政権に支持され、政治・文化に重んじられた。
sen.e: In contrast to the Soto Zen sect which spread through regional clans and the general populace, the Rinzai sect often received support from Samurai families in government, and was esteemed in government and culture.

In contrast to the Soto Zen sect which spread through regional clans and the general people, the Rinzai Sect often received support from Samurai families in the government, and was esteemed in the politics and culture.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。表記の統一。
sen.e: In contrast to the Soto Zen school which spreads through regional clans and the general people, the Rinzai School received support from Samurai families in government, and was esteemed in the politics and culture.
sen.cmt: 「spread」を「spreads」に、「the government」を「 government」に修正、「often」を削除しました（再チェック）。

sen.j: その後時代を下り、江戸時代に白隠禅師によって臨済宗が再建されたため、現在の臨済禅は白隠禅ともいわれている。
sen.e: Ages later, the Rinzai sect was rebuilt in the Edo period by Master HAKUIN, and so is also called Hakuin Zen.
Later, the Rinzai Sect was rebuilt in the Edo period by Master HAKUIN, and is also called Hakuin Zen.
Later, the Rinzai School was rebuilt in the Edo period by Master HAKUIN, and continued to be called Hakuin Zen.
sen.cmt: 「is also called」を「continued to be」に修正しました（再チェック）。

sen.j: 伝統
sen.e: Traditions
Traditions
Traditions

sen.j: 法嗣という師匠から弟子へと悟りの伝達が続き現在に至る。
sen.e: Transmission (called Hasshu) of enlightenment from master to disciple continues down to the present day.
sen.cmt: A Rinzai term for transmission of enlightenment
sen.e: Transmission (called Hasshu) of enlightenment from masters to disciples continues down to the present day.
Transmission of enlightenment from masters to disciples continues down to the present day (Hassu is the disciple who inherited the teaching of the master).
sen.cmt: Hasshu →Hassu Hassu又はHoushi (法嗣）とは、師匠の教えを継いだ弟子の事であると、辞書その他に記載あり。

sen.j: 師匠と弟子の重要なやりとりは、室内の秘密と呼ばれ師匠の部屋の中から持ち出されて公開されることはない。
sen.e: The important interaction between master and disciple is considered a secret not to be taken out of the masters room and revealed publicly.
The important interaction between the master and disciple is called "a secret in the room" and is not to be taken out of the master's room and revealed publicly.
sen.cmt: 室内の秘密という名称を訳出。自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: The important interaction between the master and disciple is called "a secret in the room" and is not to be taken out of the master's room and revealed publicly.

sen.j: 師匠と弟子のやりとりや、師匠の振舞を記録した禅語録から、抜き出したものが公案（判例）とよばれ、宋代からさまざまな集成が編まれてきたが、悟りは言葉では伝えられるものではなく、現代人の文章理解で読もうとすると公案自体が拒絶する。
sen.e: What is extracted from the interactions between a master and disciple, or Zen lecture transcripts that record the actions of a master, is called a Koan (precedent) and various collections have been compiled since the Song dynasty; but enlightenment is not something that can be communicated with words, so when people today try to understand the text the Koan itself refuses to cooperate.

What is extracted from the interactions between a master and disciple, or Zen lecture transcripts that record the actions of a master, is called a Koan (precedent) and various collections have been compiled since the Song dynasty; but enlightenment is not something that can be communicated with words, so when people today try to understand the text, the Koan itself refuses them.

What is extracted from the interactions between a master and disciple, or Zen lecture transcripts that record the actions of a master, is called a Koan (precedent) and various collections have been compiled since the Song dynasty; but enlightenment is not something that can be communicated with words, so when people today try to understand the text, the Koan itself refuses them.

sen.j: しかし、悟りに導くヒントになることがらの記録であり、禅の典籍はその創立時から現在に至るまで非常に多い。
sen.e: However, they contain hints that lead people toward enlightenment, and there are a great many Zen books from the beginning down to the present day.
However, they contain hints that lead people toward enlightenment, and there are a great many Zen books from the beginning down to the present day.
However, they contain hints that lead people toward enlightenment, and there are a great many Zen books from the beginning down to the present day.

sen.j: それとともに宋代以降、禅宗は看話禅（かんなぜん）という、禅語録を教材に老師が提要を講義する（提唱という）スタイルに変わり、臨済を初めとする唐代の祖師たちの威容は見られなくなった。
sen.e: Also since the Song dynasty, the Zen sects changed to a style in which masters give lectures using transcripts of Zen talks, called Kannazen, and starting with Rinzai in the Tang dynasty the masters did not display the same majesty.

Also since the Song dynasty, the Zen sects changed to a Kannazen style in which masters give lectures using transcripts of Zen talks and the masters became not to display the same majesty as those in the Tang dynasty including Rinzai did.

Also since the Song dynasty, the Zen schools changed to a Kannazen style in which masters give lectures using transcripts of Zen talks and the masters became not to display the same majesty as those in the Tang dynasty including Rinzai.
sen.cmt: 文末の「did」を削除しました。（再チェック）

sen.j: 師匠が肉体を去るときには少なくとも跡継ぎを選んで行くが、跡継ぎは必ずしも悟りを開いているとは限らず、その事は師匠とその弟子だけが知っている。
sen.e: Although when masters leave their bodies they at a minimum specify a successor, the successor has not necessarily attained enlightenment, but that fact is only known to the master and the disciple.
Although masters choose their successors when they died, the successors have not necessarily attained enlightenment, but that fact is only known to the master and the successor himself.
Although masters choose their successors when they die, the successors have not necessarily attained enlightenment by that time, but that fact is only known to the master and the successor himself.
sen.cmt: died →die「the successors have not necessarily attained enlightenment」を「have not necessarily attained enlightenment by that time」に修正しました。（再チェック）

sen.j: 新しい師匠が悟りを開いていなくとも、悟りを開いていた師匠の時代から数世代の間であれば、世代を越えて弟子が悟りを開くことは可能なため、その様な手段が取られる。
sen.e: Even if the new master has not attained enlightenment, if it is within a few generations of the master who did, it is possible to skip generations to a disciple.

Even though the new master has not attained enlightenment, the disciples can do so if it is within a few generations of the master who gained enlightenment, therefore it is possible to take such a measure.

Even if the new master had not attained enlightenment, the disciples would have been able to do so if it is within a few generations from that of the master who gained enlightenment, therefore it is possible to take such a measure.
sen.cmt: 仮定形に修正、「within a few generations of the master」を「within a few generations from that of the master」に修正しました。（再チェック）

sen.j: 師匠は、ひとりだけではなく複数の師匠を残して行くこともあれば、師匠の判断で跡を嗣ぐ師匠を残さずにその流れが終わることもある。
sen.e: It is possible both for a master to leave behind several new masters, or at his discretion not to leave a successor and bring his line to an end.
It is possible for a master to leave behind several new masters, or at his discretion not to leave a successor and bring his line to an end.
It is possible for a master to leave behind several new masters, or at his discretion not to leave a successor and bring his line to an end.

sen.j: いくつもの支流に分かれ、ある流れは消えて行き、その流れのいくつかが7世紀から現在まで伝わっている。
sen.e: Many lines have split, and some have disappeared; in this way some of those lines have come down from the 7th century to the present day.
Many lines have split, and some have disappeared; in this way some of those lines have come down from the 7th century to the present day.
Many lines have split, and some have disappeared; in this way some of those lines have come down from the 7th century to the present day.

sen.j: 悟り
sen.e: Enlightenment
Enlightenment
Enlightenment

sen.j: 一般に禅宗は知識ではなく、悟りを重んじる。
sen.e: The Zen sects generally emphasize enlightenment over knowledge.
The Zen sects generally emphasize enlightenment over knowledge.
The Zen sects generally emphasize enlightenment over knowledge.

sen.j: 禅宗における悟りとは、生きるもの全てが本来持っている本性である仏性に気付くことを言う。
sen.e: Enlightenment in Zen means to realize the inherent buddha nature that all living things possess.
Enlightenment in Zen means that all living things realize the inherent buddha nature they possess.
Enlightenment in Zen means that all living things realize the inherent buddha nature they possess.

sen.j: このため、唐代の祖師たちは苦闘を重ねながら悟ってきたのである。
sen.e: For this reason, the Tang dynasty masters came to enlightenment through much hardship.
For this reason, masters in the Tang dynasty came to enlightenment through much hardship.
For this reason, masters in the Tang dynasty struggled to enlightenment through much hardship.

sen.j: しかし宋代以降、悟りを得るための多くの技法が考案されてきた。
sen.e: However, from the Song dynasty on, they came up with many techniques for gaining enlightenment.
However, from the Song dynasty on, they came up with many techniques for gaining enlightenment.
However, they began to devise many techniques for gaining enlightenment from the Song dynasty.

sen.j: 坐禅（瞑想とは異なる）、公案（知的な理解を超えた話を理解すること）、読経（お教を読むこと）、作務（普段の作業）などの修行を既に悟りを得た禅師の元ですることで、悟りが得られるようにメソッド化されてきた。
sen.e: These were systematized so that enlightenment could be gained by performing training such as zazen (not the same as meditation), Koan (understanding stories that surpass intellectual understanding), reading sutras, or work under an already enlightened Zen master.

These were systematized so that enlightenment could be gained by performing training such as zazen (not the same as meditation), Koan (understanding stories that surpass intellectual understanding), reading sutras, or work under an already enlightened Zen master.

These were systematized so that enlightenment could be gained by performing training such as Zazen (not the same as meditation), Koan (understanding stories that surpass intellectual understanding), Dokyou (reading sutras), or Samu (everyday work) under an already enlightened Zen master.
sen.cmt: zazen→ Zazen DokyouとSamu (everyday work) が抜けているので補足。

sen.j: 悟りは、ロウソクの火が、消えているロウソクに伝わるように（伝灯）、師から弟子へと伝わるとされる。
sen.e: Enlightenment is thought to pass from master to disciple as a candle flame passes to a candle that is unlit.
Enlightenment is thought to pass from the master to the disciple as a candle flame passes to a candle that is unlit.
Enlightenment is thought to pass from the master to the disciple as a candle flame passes to a candle that is unlit (called Dentou).

sen.j: それは言葉（ロゴス）による伝達ではない。
sen.e: That is not a transmission based on words (logos).
That is not a transmission based on words (logos).
That is not a transmission based on words (logos).

sen.j: それゆえに正しい禅師を選ぶことが肝心とされる。
sen.e: That is why it is considered crucial to choose the right Zen master.
For this reason, it is considered crucial to choose the right Zen master.
For this reason, it is considered crucial to choose the right Zen master.

sen.j: それは悟りを得ている事だけではなく、自分の個性に適合している禅師を選ぶという意味もある。
sen.e: That means not just choosing one who has gained enlightenment, but one who fits with one's own personality.
That means not just choosing one who has gained enlightenment, but one who fits with one's own personality.
That means not just choosing one who has gained enlightenment, but one who fits with one's own personality.

sen.j: しかしながら、悟りを得た禅師が指導して悟らせるのではない。
sen.e: Actually, it is not the case that an enlightened Zen master instructs and causes someone to be enlightened.
Actually, it does not mean that an enlightened Zen master instructs and lets someone gain enlightenment.
Actually, it does not mean that an enlightened Zen master instructs and enables someone gain enlightenment.

sen.j: 師を持たずに悟りを得たゴータマ・シッダッタ（仏陀、釈尊）を持ち出すまでもなく、唐代の祖師たちは、師匠から教わって悟ったのではないのである。
sen.e: The Tang dynasty masters did not learn enlightenment from anybody - not to mention Siddhartha Gautama, who gained enlightenment without a teacher.
Masters in the Tang dynasty did not learn enlightenment from anybody - not to mention Siddhartha Gautama, who gained enlightenment without a teacher.
Masters in the Tang dynasty did not learn to get enlightenment from anybody - not to mention Siddhartha Gautama (Buddha, Shakuson), who gained enlightenment without a teacher.
sen.cmt: 本文の仏陀、釈尊を補足。「learn」を[learn to get」に修正。（再チェック）

sen.j: 悟りを言葉により定義することは出来ないが、言葉を始めとしていろいろな方法で悟りの境地を表現することはできる。
sen.e: While it is impossible to define enlightenment with words, words are one of many methods that can describe the boundaries of enlightenment.
While it is impossible to define enlightenment with words, words are one of many methods that can describe the boundaries of enlightenment.
While it is impossible to define enlightenment with words, words are one of many methods that can describe the boundaries of enlightenment.
sen.cmt: 「words are 」を「language is」に修正。（再チェック）

sen.j: そのため特に日本に伝わった後、詩や絵画を始めとした芸術的な表現の上に悟りが表現されており、その香りを味わうことができる。
sen.e: That is why, especially after it was brought to Japan, enlightenment has been expressed through artistic expression such as poetry and painting, so that one can get a taste of its aroma.
That is why, especially after it was brought to Japan, enlightenment has been expressed through artistic expression such as poetry and painting, so that one can get a taste of its aroma.
That is why, especially after it was brought to Japan, enlightenment has been expressed through artistic expression such as poetry and painting, so that one can get a taste of its aroma.

sen.j: 芸術以外にも、茶道や華道を始めとした振舞いなどにも表現されており、振舞いをたどることによって、悟りの世界を味わうという手段も生まれている。
sen.e: Other than in art, it is also expressed in such actions as the tea ceremony and flower arrangement; and ways to get a taste of the world of enlightenment have been born.
Other than in art, it is also expressed in such actions as the tea ceremony and flower arrangement; and methods to get a taste of the world of enlightenment have been born.
Other than in art, it is also expressed in deportments such as tea ceremony and flower arrangement; and methods to get a taste of the world of enlightenment have also been born.

sen.j: それは知的な理解ではない。
sen.e: That is not an intellectual understanding.
That is not an intellectual understanding.
That is not an intellectual understanding.

sen.j: 公案体系
sen.e: The Koan System
The Koan System
The Koan System

sen.j: 宋代以降公案体系がまとめられ、擬似的かもしれないが更に多くの悟りを起こすことを可能にした。
sen.e: The Koan system came together after the Song dynasty, and though they might be fabricated it has made even more enlightenments possible.
The Koan system came together after the Song dynasty, and though they might be fabricated it has made even more enlightenments possible.
The Koan system came together after the Song dynasty, and though they might be fabricated it has made even more enlightenments possible.

sen.j: 公案とは、主に師と弟子の間の会話で構成され、弟子が悟りを得る瞬間の事実を伝える話が多い。
sen.e: Most Koan are made up of conversations between a master and disciple, telling the truth of the moment when the disciple gained enlightenment.
Most Koan are made up of conversations between a master and disciple, telling the truth of the moment when the disciple gained enlightenment.
Most Koan are made up of conversations between a master and disciple, telling the truth of the moment when the disciple gained enlightenment.

sen.j: また公案とは論理的、知的な理解を受け付ける事が出来ない、論理を超えた話であり、考えることではなく、公案になり切ることを通してのみ知ることができる。
sen.e: Koan cannot be received with logical, intellectual understanding, but are stories beyond logic that cannot be understood by thinking, but only by becoming the Koan.
Koan cannot be received with logical, intellectual understanding, and is stories beyond logic that can be understood only by becoming the Koan, not by thinking.
Koan cannot be received with logical, intellectual understanding, and are stories beyond logic that can be understood only by completely becoming the Koan itself instead of thinking.
sen.cmt: 「is」を[are]に、「 becoming the Koan, not by thinking.」を「 completely becoming the Koan itself instead of thinking」に修正。（再チェック）

sen.j: これらの公案を弟子を導く手順としてまとめたのが公案体系であり、500から1900の公案により構成される。
sen.e: These Koan that were collected as a method for leading disciples are the Koan system, which is composed of between 500 and 1900 Koan.
The Koan system was established by collecting these Koan stories as a method for leading disciples and is composed of 500 to 1900 Koan stories.
The Koan system was established by collecting these Koan stories as a method for leading disciples and was composed of 500 to 1900 Koan stories.

sen.j: 公案体系は師の家風によって異なる。
sen.e: Koan differ according to the masters style.
Koan system differs according to the master's style.
Koan system differs according to the master's style.

sen.j: 初期に与えられる公案の例：
sen.e: An Example of a Beginner's Koan
Examples of Beginner's Koan stories
Examples of Koan stories in the beginning.

sen.j: 「犬に仏性はありますか?」「無（む）」
sen.e: "Does a dog have buddha-nature?" "It does not have."
"Does a dog have buddha-nature?" "It does not have."
"Does a dog have buddha-nature?" "It does not have."

sen.j: この背景には、仏教では誰でも知っている「全ての生き物は仏性を持っている」という知識がある。
sen.e: As background, any Buddhist knows that "all living things have Buddha-nature."
As the background, any Buddhist knows that "all living things have Buddha-nature."
As the background, any Buddhist knows that "all living things have Buddha-nature."

sen.j: 「片手の拍手の音」
sen.e: The Sound of One Hand Clapping
The Sound of One Hand Clapping
The Sound of One Hand Clapping

sen.j: 弟子は片手でする拍手の音を聞いてそれを師匠に示さなければならない。
sen.e: The disciple has to listen to the sound of clapping with one hand and show that to the teacher.
A disciple has to listen to the sound of clapping with one hand and show that to the master.
sen.cmt: 特定の弟子ではないのでaにした。師匠の表記の統一。
sen.e: A disciple has to listen to the sound of clapping with one hand and show that to the master.

sen.j: 知的な理解では片手では拍手はできず音はしない。
sen.e: With only intellectual understanding, it is impossible to clap with one hand and there is no sound.
With intellectual understanding, it is impossible to clap with one hand and make a sound.
By intellectual understanding, it is impossible to clap with one hand and make a sound.

sen.j: 宗派
sen.e: Branches
Branches
Sects

sen.j: 建仁寺派
sen.e: Kenniji Branch
Kenniji Branch
Kenni-ji sect

sen.j: 1202年（建仁2年）、中国・南宋に渡って帰国した栄西により始まる。
sen.e: Began when Eisai came back from Southern Song China in 1202 (Kenni Year 2).
The branch began when Eisai came back from Southern Song China in 1202.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。西洋暦のみの使用。
sen.e: The sect began when Eisai came back from Southern Song China in 1202.
sen.cmt: 原文に基づき、建仁2年を補足。日本の話なので、書いた方が良いと思う。

sen.j: 栄西は最初に禅の伝統を日本に伝えた。
sen.e: Eisai was the first to bring the Zen tradition to Japan.
Eisai was the first to bring the Zen tradition to Japan.
Eisai was the first to bring the Zen tradition to Japan.

sen.j: 大本山は、京都の建仁寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Kenniji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Kenniji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Kenni-ji in Kyoto.

sen.j: 建仁寺は日本最古の禅寺である。
sen.e: Kenniji is the oldest Zen temple in Japan.
Kenniji is the oldest Zen temple in Japan.
Kenni-ji is the oldest Zen temple in Japan.

sen.j: 東福寺派
sen.e: Tofukuji Branch
Tofukuji Branch
Tofuku-ji sect

sen.j: 1236年、宋に渡り帰国した円爾（弁円）により京都で始まる。
sen.e: Began in Kyoto when Benen ENNI returned from Song China in 1236.
The branch began in Kyoto when Benen ENNI returned from Song China in 1236.
The sect began in Kyoto when Benen ENNI returned from Song China in 1236.

sen.j: 本山は、京都の東福寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Tofukuji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Tofukuji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Tofuku-ji in Kyoto.

sen.j: 戦国時代、毛利家の外交僧として活躍した安国寺恵瓊はこの宗派。
sen.e: Ekei ANKOKUJI, who was a diplomat for the Mori clan in the Warring States period, was from this sect.
Ekei ANKOKUJI, who was a monk and also acted as a diplomat for the Mori clan in the Warring States period, belonged to this school.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。「僧」の表現を追加。「宗派」の表現を修正。
sen.e: Ekei ANKOKUJI, who was a monk and also acted as a diplomat for the Mori clan in the Warring States period, belonged to this school.

sen.j: 建長寺派
sen.e: Kenchoji Branch
Kenchoji Branch
Kencho-ji sect

sen.j: 1253年、鎌倉幕府五代執権・北条時頼が中国・南宋から招いた蘭渓道隆により始まる。
sen.e: Began in 1253 with Douryuu RANKEI, who was invited to come from Southern Song China by Tokiyori KITAJOU, the 5th regent of the Kamakura Shogunate.
The branch was established by Douryuu RANKEI in 1253, who was invited from Southern Song China by Tokiyori HOJOU, the 5th regent of the Kamakura Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。「北条」の表記を修正。
sen.e: The sect was established by Douryuu RANKEI in 1253, who was invited from Southern Song China by Tiyori HOJOU, the 5th regent of the Kamakura Shogunate.

sen.j: 本山は、蘭渓道隆が開山した鎌倉の建長寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Kenchoji in Kamakura, founded by Douryou RANKEI.
Head temple is Kenchoji in Kamakura, founded by Douryuu RANKEI.
Head temple is Kencho-ji in Kamakura, founded by Douryuu RANKEI.

sen.j: 建長寺は日本で初めて純粋な禅の道場が開かれた日本で最初の禅寺で、一時は1000人以上の禅僧が修行をしていた。
sen.e: Kenchoji was the first pure Zen training hall to be opened in Japan, with over 1000 monks training there at one time.
Kenchoji was the first Zen temple that opened the first pure Zen training hall in Japan, with more than 1,000 monks training there at one time.
Kencho-ji was the first Zen temple that opened the first pure Zen training hall in Japan, with more than 1,000 monks training there at one time.

sen.j: 円覚寺派
sen.e: Enkakuji Branch
Enkakuji Branch
Enkaku-ji sect

sen.j: 1282年 中国から招かれた無学祖元により鎌倉で始まる。
sen.e: Began in Kamakura in 1282 when Sogen MUGAKU was invited from China.
The branch began in Kamakura in 1282 when Sogen MUGAKU was invited from China.
The sect began in Kamakura in 1282 when Sogen MUGAKU was invited from China.

sen.j: 本山は、鎌倉の円覚寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Enkakuji in Kamakura.
Head temple is Enkakuji in Kamakura.
Head temple is Enkaku-ji in Kamakura.

sen.j: 円覚寺は、無学祖元から高峰顕日・夢窓疎石へと受け継がれ日本の禅の中心となった時期もある。
sen.e: Enkakuji was passed from Sogen MUGAKU to Kennichi KOUHOU to Soseki MUSOU, and was at one time the center of Japanese Zen.
Enkakuji was passed from Sogen MUGAKU to Kennichi KOUHOU and Soseki MUSOU, and was at one time the center of Japanese Zen.
Enkaku-ji Temple was passed from Sogen MUGAKU to Kennichi KOUHOU and Soseki MUSOU, and was at one time the center of Japanese Zen.

sen.j: 明治以降の有名な禅師は、今北洪川・釈宗演・朝比奈宗源。
sen.e: Famous Zen masters after Meiji include Kousen IMAKITA, Souen SHAKU, and Sougen ASAHINA.
Famous Zen masters after the Meiji period include Kousen IMAKITA, Souen SHAKU, and Sougen ASAHINA.
Famous Zen masters after the Meiji period include Kousen IMAKITA, Souen SHAKU, and Sougen ASAHINA.

sen.j: 禅を西洋に紹介した鈴木大拙は今北と釈宗演の両師の元に在家の居士として参禅した。
sen.e: Daisetsu SUZUKI and Souen SHAKU, who introduced Zen to the West, originally came here as lay buddhists.
Daisetsu SUZUKI who introduced Zen to the West experienced Zen under the two masters, IMAKITA and Souen SHAKU as a lay buddhist.
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映させるため修正。
sen.e: Daisetsu SUZUKI who introduced Zen to the West experienced Zen under the two masters, IMAKITA and Souen SHAKU as a lay buddhist.

sen.j: また夏目漱石も釈宗演に参じており、その経験は「門」に描かれている。
sen.e: Also, Soseki NATSUME approached Souen SHAKU and wrote about that experience in The Gate.
Also, Soseki NATSUME approached Souen SHAKU and wrote about that experience in The Gate.
Also, Soseki NATSUME approached Souen SHAKU and wrote about that experience in The Gate.

sen.j: 南禅寺派
sen.e: Nanzenji Branch
Nanzenji Branch
Nanzen-ji sect

sen.j: 1291年、無関普門により始まる。
sen.e: Began with Fumon MUKAN in 1291.
The branch began by Fumon MUKAN in 1291.
The sect began by Fumon MUKAN in 1291.

sen.j: 本山は、京都の南禅寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Nanzenji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Nanzenji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Nanzen-ji in Kyoto.

sen.j: 国泰寺派
sen.e: Kokutaiji Branch
Kokutaiji Branch
Kokutai-ji sect

sen.j: 1300年頃、慈雲妙意により始まる。
sen.e: Began with Myoi JIUN around 1300.
The branch began by Myoi JIUN around 1300.
The sect began by Myoi JIUN around 1300.

sen.j: 総本山は、明治時代に山岡鉄舟の尽力で再興した富山県高岡市にある国泰寺 (高岡市)。
sen.e: Head temple is Kokutaiji (Takaoka City), rebuilt in the Meiji period in Toyama Prefecture, Takaoka City, thanks to Teshuu YAMAOKA.
Head temple is Kokutaiji (Takaoka City in Toyama Prefecture), which is rebuilt in the Meiji period by Teshuu YAMAOKA.
Head temple is Kokutai-ji (Takaoka City in Toyama Prefecture), which was rebuilt in the Meiji period by Tesshuu YAMAOKA.
sen.cmt: 寺名の表記を修正。is→was 過去の出来事なので修正。 てっしゅうなので、Teshuu→Tesshuu

sen.j: 鉄舟開基の谷中の全生庵も国泰寺派の名刹である。
sen.e: Taninaka-no-Zenseian, founded by Tesshuu, is a famous temple of the Kokutaiji branch.
Taninaka-no-Zenseian, founded by Tesshuu, is a famous temple of the Kokutaiji branch.
Taninaka-no-Zenseian, founded by Tesshuu, is a famous temple of the Kokutai-ji sect.
sen.cmt: branchをsectに修正。寺名の表記を修正

sen.j: 大徳寺派
sen.e: Daitokuji Branch
Daitokuji Branch
Daitoku-ji sect

sen.j: 1315年、宗峰妙超により始まる。
sen.e: Began in 1315 with Myouchou SHUUHOU.
The branch began in 1315 by Myouchou SHUUHOU.
The sect began in 1315 by Myouchou SHUUHOU.

sen.j: 本山は、京都の大徳寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Daitokuji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Daitokuji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Daitoku-ji in Kyoto.

sen.j: 室町時代には応仁の乱で荒廃したが、一休宗純が復興した。
sen.e: It was razed in the Onin War in the Muromachi period, but Soujun IKKYUU rebuilt it.
It was razed during the Onin War in the Muromachi period, but Soujun IKKYUU rebuilt it.
It was razed during the Onin War in the Muromachi period, but Soujun IKKYUU rebuilt it.

sen.j: 向嶽寺派
sen.e: Kogakuji Branch
Kogakuji Branch
Kogaku-ji sect

sen.j: 1327年、抜隊得勝により始まる。
sen.e: Began with Tokushou BASSUI in 1327.
The branch began by Tokushou BASSUI in 1327.
The sect began by Tushou BASSUI in 1327.

sen.j: 本山は、山梨県甲州市の向嶽寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Kogakuji in Koushuu City, Yamagata Prefecture.
Head temple is Kogakuji in Koushuu City, Yamanashi Prefecture.
Head temple is Kogaku-ji in Koushuu City, Yamanashi Prefecture.

sen.j: 妙心寺派
sen.e: Myoshinji Branch
Myoshinji Branch
Myoshin-ji sect

sen.j: 1337年、関山慧玄により始まる。
sen.e: Began in 1337 with Egen KANZAN.
The branch began in 1337 by Egen KANZAN.
The sect began in 1337 by Egen KANZAN.

sen.j: 本山は、京都の妙心寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Myoshinji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Myoshinji in Kyoto.
Head temple is Myoshin-ji in Kyoto.

sen.j: 塔頭寺院には、桂春院・春光院・退蔵院などがある。
sen.e: Subsidiary temples include Keishunin, Shunkouin, and Taizouin.
Subsidiary temples include Keishunin, Shunkouin, and Taizouin.
sen.cmt: スペースの間隔を修正。
sen.e: Subsidiary temples include Keishunin, Shunkouin, and Taizouin.

sen.j: 末寺3,400余ヵ寺を持つ臨済宗最大の宗派。
sen.e: It is the largest branch of Rinzai, with over 3400 branch temples.
It is the largest branch in Rinzai Sect, with more than 3,400 branch temples.
It is the largest sect of the Rinzai School, with more than 3,400 sect temples.
sen.cmt: in Rinzai Sect→of the Rinzai Sectでは？

sen.j: 天龍寺派
sen.e: Tenryuji Branch
Tenryuji Branch
Tenryu-ji sect

sen.j: 1339年、夢窓疎石により始まる。
sen.e: Began in 1339 with Soseki MUSOU.
The branch began in 1339 by Soseki MUSOU.
The sect began in 1339 by Soseki MUSOU.

sen.j: 本山は、京都嵐山の天龍寺。
sen.e: Head temple is Tenruji in Arashiyama, Kyoto.
Head temple is Tenryuji in Arashiyama, Kyoto.

sen.j: 永源寺派
sen.e: Eigenji Branch
Eigenji Branch
Eigen-ji sect

sen.j: 1361年 寂室元光により始まる。
sen.e: Began in 1361 with Genkou JAKUSHITSU.
The branch began in 1361 by Genkou JAKUSHITSU.
The sect began in 1361 by Genkou JAKUSHITSU.

sen.j: 本山は、滋賀県東近江市にある永源寺 (東近江市)。
sen.e: Head temple is Eigenji in Higashioumiya City, Shiga Prefecture (Higashioumiya City).
Head temple is Eigenji in Higashioumi City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 東近江市の表記修正。自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: Head temple is Eigen-ji in Higashioumi City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 末寺は、滋賀県を中心に約150ヶ寺。
sen.e: 150 branch temples centered around Shiga Prefecture.
It has about 150 branch temples mainly in the area of Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。「約」という言葉を追加。
sen.e: It has about 150 branch temples mainly in the area of Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 明治13年（1880年）までは東福寺派に属した。
sen.e: Was affiliated with Tofukuji branch until Meiji 13 (1880).
Belonged to the Tofukuji branch until 1880.
Belonged to the Tofuku-ji sect until 1880.
sen.cmt: 寺名表記の修正、branchをsectに修正

sen.j: 方広寺派
sen.e: Hokoji Branch
Hokoji Branch
Hoko-ji sect

sen.j: 1384年、無文元選により始まる。
sen.e: Began with Gensen MUMON in 1384.
The branch began by Gensen MUMON in 1384.
The sect began by Gensen MUMON in 1384.

sen.j: 本山は、浜松市北区引佐町の方広寺 (浜松市)。
sen.e: Head temple is Hokoji in Inasa Town, Hamamatsu City.
Head temple is Hokoji in Inasa Town, Kita-ku, Hamamatsu City.
Head temple is Hoko-ji in Inasa Town, Kita-ku, Hamamatsu City.

sen.j: 末寺は、静岡県を中心に約170ヶ寺。
sen.e: About 170 branch temples centered in Shizuoka Prefecture.
It has about 170 branch temples mainly in the area of Shizuoka Prefecture.
It has about 170 branch temples mainly in the area of Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 明治37年（1904年）までは南禅寺派に属した。
sen.e: Was affiliated with the Nanzenji branch until Meiji 37 (1904).
Belonged to the Nanzenji branch until 1904.
Belonged to the Nanzen-ji sect until 1904.

Shokokuji Branch

sen.j: 本山は、足利義満により建立された京都の相国寺。

Head temple is Shokokuji in Kyoto, established by Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.
Head temple is Shokoku-ji in Kyoto, established by Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 末寺は、全国に約100ヶ寺。

It has about 100 branch temples nationwide.
It has about 100 branch temples nationwide.

sen.j: 金閣寺・銀閣寺が属する。

Kinkakuji and Ginkakuji belong to the branch.
Kinkaku-ji Temple and Ginkaku-ji Temple are affiliated.

sen.e: Head temple is Buttsuji in Mihara City, Hiroshima Prefecture.
